hanzi-su-wiki:
倉

Значения

Склад, кладовая

Мнемоника

Упрощено. Амбар 口, где хранят зерно для еды 食.

Варианты

仓
purpleculture_pinyin:
cāng
barn; granary; storehouse; cabin; hold (in ship)
сарай; зернохранилище; склад; кабина; держать (на корабле)
rtega_mnemonic:
倉倉RS
仓仓		仺warehouse, storehouse, granary, berth, sea
  • people 口 eating 食 from the foods stored at the warehouse
  • ⓢ people 人⺋ packed together in a storehouse
purpleculture_info:
(Simplified: 仓)
Ideographic: A granary with a roof 人, door 户, and foundation 口
purpleculture_examples:
倉庫 [ cāng kù ]: depot; storehouse; warehouse
倉儲 [ cāng chǔ ]: to store in a warehouse
倉皇 [ cāng huáng ]: in a panic; flurried
倉促 [ cāng cù ]: all of a sudden; hurriedly
purpleculture_tree:
• ⿱ Above to below
    • 人 [ rén ] man, person; people
    • ⿸ Surround from upper left
      • 户 [ hù ] door; family
      • 口 [ kǒu ] mouth; entrance, gate, opening
heisig_chinese_memo: Imagine a storehouse where you can meet girls who will godown on you with their mouth. To keep the place a bit of a secret, they only have one gate with an old umbrella on top to make it look like it's unused.
heisig_constituent: godown, meeting, single gate, umbrella, stable door, mouth
heisig_story: The single gate is used here not in order to represent one gate, but many of them, indeed a meeting of gates. Add mouth (as an entrance here) and you end up with godown. That should help keep this character distinct from warehouse (Frame 633).
koohiiStory1: A godown is a dockside warehouse. This is actually a meeting of large doors and mouths. The stroke order is the same as door, not gates, just with the top stroke moved down into the now larger door.
koohiiStory2: Note: this is not gate but actually a variation of door and is written as such, with the vertical stroke last not first.
WaniKani_Meaning_Mnemonic: The warehouse radical and the warehouse kanji are the same!
WaniKani_Reading_Mnemonic: You have a warehouse to store all of your souls (そう). When people or animals you know pass away, you take their souls and store them in your dry warehouse for safekeeping. It's a public service, really.
WaniKani_Reading_Info: Imagine if you kept a bunch of souls in a warehouse. This way they can't haunt anyone. And they can't get lost out in the spirit world. The warehouse is best for them.
Ru_Radicals: ノ, 个 (китайский счётный суффикс), 口 (рот)
Kanshudo_mnemonic: the assembly (亼) of mouths (口) is around the one (一) corpse (尸) in the storehouse
chinese_mnemonics_deck__story: Storehouses are getting very secure these days.  This umbrella storehouse requires fingerprint authentication to enter.
humanum_full_description_en:
Oracle from the " co " from " user " or " gate ," as granary, a place to store grain. The upper part is like a roof, the lower part is like a grain storage pit, and in the middle is the warehouse door (Xu Shen, Sun Haibo, Shen Pei, Ji Xusheng, Ma Rusen, Zhang Shichao, Jin Guotai, etc.). The word " warehouse " later generally refers to buildings where materials are stored. "Said Wen": "Cang, storage and storage. Canghuang is taken and stored, so it is called a warehouse. From food to province, the mouth is like a warehouse. All warehouses belong to the warehouse. A, odd word warehouse." Duan Yu Judging Note: "The one who holds the valley means the place where the valley hides."

The oracle bone inscription is suspected to be used as the original meaning, which means the warehouse of the Tibetan valley, "Tun" 3731: "Yu Xicang".

Bronze inscriptions are used as the original meaning to indicate Canglin Mansion Treasury, Yiyang Youcangding: "Yiyang Youcang". "Mandarin. "Vietnamese" under: "Fu Cang Shi, people Yin." Wei Zhao's note: "Huo Cai is called Mansion, Mi Su is called Cang." Also used as an onomatopoeia, "Cang Cang Liao", that is, "guns and guns" ", to describe the bell. The person reduces the bell: "Hehe and Cangcang...smell it all around (square)." It means that the sound of the bell is harmonious and pleasant, and anyone from all directions can hear it. Also used as surname and name. "Tong Chi. Clan Strategy": "The Cang clan, after Cang Jie, the historian of the Yellow Emperor, or those who have been in charge of the Cang Yu in ancient times, each considers the clan." Diao Cang Fu Xun: "Hang (uncle) Cang Fu Zha (as) Bao Xie."

The bamboo slips of the Warring States Period are used as the names of people, "Shangbo Bamboo Book II. Rongchengshi": "Cangjie". " Cang " in Changshatan Library "Chu Silk Script" can be used as " phase ", that is, "Erya. Release day "in December of the name" phase ", referring to July. "Er Ya. "Shi Tian": "July is the phase." "poetry. Xiaoya. "Chu Ci": "I Cang Jiying", "Taiping Yulan" volume 35 quotes " cang " as " box " (see He Linyi, Wang Hui).
humanum_short_description_en: Oracle from the " co " from " user " or " gate ," as granary, a place to store grain. The upper part is like a roof, the lower part is like a grain storage pit, and in the middle is the warehouse door (Xu Shen, Sun Haibo, Shen Pei, Ji Xusheng, Ma Rusen, Zhang Shichao, Jin Guotai, etc.). The word " warehouse " later generally refers to buildings where materials are stored.
humanum_full_description:
甲骨文從「合」從「戶」或「門」，象糧倉，是收藏穀物的地方。上面(亼)象屋頂，下面(口)象儲糧的坑，中間是倉庫的門(許慎、孫海波、沈培、季旭昇、馬如森、張世超、金國泰等)。「倉」字後來泛指儲藏物資的建築物。《說文》：「倉，榖藏也。倉黃取而藏之，故謂之倉。从食省，口象倉形。凡倉之屬皆从倉。仺，奇字倉。」段玉裁注：「穀藏者，謂穀所藏之處。」

　　甲骨文疑用作本義，表示藏穀之倉，《屯》3731：「于西倉」。

　　金文用作本義，表示倉廩府庫，宜陽右倉鼎：「宜陽右倉」。《國語．越語》下：「府倉實，民眾殷。」韋昭注：「貨財曰府，米粟曰倉。」又用作象聲詞，㝬鐘：「倉倉悤悤」，即「鎗鎗鏓鏓」，形容鐘聲。者減鐘：「龢龢倉倉……聞于四旁(方)。」表示鐘聲龢諧悅耳，四方之人都能聽到。又用作姓氏和人名。《通志．氏族略》：「倉氏，黃帝史官倉頡之後，或言古有世掌倉庾者，各以為氏。」弔倉父盨：「弔(叔)倉父乍(作)寶盨。」

　　戰國竹簡用作人名，《上博竹書二．容成氏》：「倉頡」。長沙子彈庫《楚帛書》「倉」通假作「相」，即《爾雅．釋天》十二月名之「相」，指七月。《爾雅．釋天》：「七月為相」。《詩．小雅．楚茨》：「我倉既盈」，《太平御覽》卷35引「倉」作「箱」(參何琳儀、王輝)。
humanum_short_description: 甲骨文從「合」從「戶」或「門」，象糧倉，是收藏穀物的地方。上面(亼)象屋頂，下面(口)象儲糧的坑，中間是倉庫的門(許慎、孫海波、沈培、季旭昇、馬如森、張世超、金國泰等)。「倉」字後來泛指儲藏物資的建築物。

倉庫(そうこ): storehouse, warehouse

甲骨文從「 合 」從「 戶 」或「 門 」，象糧倉，是收藏穀物的地方。上面(亼)象屋頂，下面(口)象儲糧的坑，中間是倉庫的門(許慎、孫海波、沈培、季旭昇、馬如森、張世超、金國泰等)。「 倉 」字後來泛指儲藏物資的建築物。《說文》：「倉，榖藏也。倉黃取而藏之，故謂之倉。从食省，口象倉形。凡倉之屬皆从倉。仺，奇字倉。」段玉裁注：「穀藏者，謂穀所藏之處。」 甲骨文疑用作本義，表示藏穀之倉，《屯》3731：「于西倉」。 金文用作本義，表示倉廩府庫，宜陽右倉鼎：「宜陽右倉」。《國語．越語》下：「府倉實，民眾殷。」韋昭注：「貨財曰府，米粟曰倉。」又用作象聲詞，㝬鐘：「倉倉悤悤」，即「鎗鎗鏓鏓」，形容鐘聲。者減鐘：「龢龢倉倉……聞于四旁(方)。」表示鐘聲龢諧悅耳，四方之人都能聽到。又用作姓氏和人名。《通志．氏族略》：「倉氏，黃帝史官倉頡之後，或言古有世掌倉庾者，各以為氏。」弔倉父盨：「弔(叔)倉父乍(作)寶盨。」 戰國竹簡用作人名，《上博竹書二．容成氏》：「倉頡」。長沙子彈庫《楚帛書》「 倉 」通假作「 相 」，即《爾雅．釋天》十二月名之「 相 」，指七月。《爾雅．釋天》：「七月為相」。《詩．小雅．楚茨》：「我倉既盈」，《太平御覽》卷35引「 倉 」作「 箱 」(參何琳儀、王輝)。
Oracle from the " co" from " user" or " gate," as granary, a place to store grain. The upper part is like a roof, the lower part is like a grain storage pit, and in the middle is the warehouse door (Xu Shen, Sun Haibo, Shen Pei, Ji Xusheng, Ma Rusen, Zhang Shichao, Jin Guotai, etc.). The word " warehouse" later generally refers to buildings where materials are stored. "Said Wen": "Cang, storage and storage. Canghuang is taken and stored, so it is called a warehouse. From food to province, the mouth is like a warehouse. All warehouses belong to the warehouse. A, odd word warehouse." Duan Yu Judging Note: "The one who holds the valley means the place where the valley hides." The oracle bone inscription is suspected to be used as the original meaning, which means the warehouse of the Tibetan valley, "Tun" 3731: "Yu Xicang". Bronze inscriptions are used as the original meaning to indicate Canglin Mansion Treasury, Yiyang Youcangding: "Yiyang Youcang". "Mandarin. "Vietnamese" under: "Fu Cang Shi, people Yin." Wei Zhao's note: "Huo Cai is called Mansion, Mi Su is called Cang." Also used as an onomatopoeia, "Cang Cang Liao", that is, "guns and guns" ", to describe the bell. The person reduces the bell: "Hehe and Cangcang...smell it all around (square)." It means that the sound of the bell is harmonious and pleasant, and anyone from all directions can hear it. Also used as surname and name. "Tong Chi. Clan Strategy": "The Cang clan, after Cang Jie, the historian of the Yellow Emperor, or those who have been in charge of the Cang Yu in ancient times, each considers the clan." Diao Cang Fu Xun: "Hang (uncle) Cang Fu Zha (as) Bao Xie." The bamboo slips of the Warring States Period are used as the names of people, "Shangbo Bamboo Book II. Rongchengshi": "Cangjie". " Cang" in Changshatan Library "Chu Silk Script" can be used as " phase", that is, "Erya. Release day "in December of the name" phase", referring to July. "Er Ya. "Shi Tian": "July is the phase." "poetry. Xiaoya. "Chu Ci": "I Cang Jiying", "Taiping Yulan" volume 35 quotes " cang" as " box" (see He Linyi, Wang Hui).
